item.title: Michael add a quote by PJ Haarsma
Michael add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Michael add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Michael add a quote by James A. Owen
item.description: "Our weaknesses are always evident, both to ourselves and others. But our strengths are hidden until we choose to reveal them--and that is when we are truly tested. When all that we have within is exposed, and we may no longer blame our inadequacies for our failure, but must instead depend upon our strengths to succeed ... that is when the measure of a man is taken, my boy." -- James A. Owen

item.title: Michael add a quote by Alton Brown
item.description: "The journey of a thousand miles begins with a cash advance." -- Alton Brown

item.title: Michael add a quote by Tsugumi Ohba
item.description: "No one can tell what is righteous and what is wrong, what is good and what is evil." -- Tsugumi Ohba
